I've started a [repo](https://github.com/SnippyHolloW/DL4H) where I'd like to put some very basic but also very didactic (i.e. python+numpy and/or C) code about all stuff machine learning.

So the first thing I did about it is a practical for my labmates at [LSCP](http://www.lscp.net/), ["From Logistic Regression to Deep Nets, a Crash Course"](http://nbviewer.ipython.org/github/SnippyHolloW/DL4H/blob/master/from_logistic_regression_to_deep_nets.ipynb). It's very imperfect, but it's "out thereâ„¢".  

E.g. it has a very basic intro to stochastic gradient descent:
{% img data:image/png;base64, %}

Now go play with it and break stuff. :)
